intro: Phlebochilus pachychilus, commonly known as the broad-leaved phlebochilus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its robust, aromatic foliage and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Native to southern Europe and western Asia, this plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are broad and lobed, often with a hairy surface, while its flowers are typically arranged in umbels. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
